ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and in the morning it was like burnt land stripped bare.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and so by morning the orchard lay as though it had been fully harvested.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and the garden was turned into a barren desert.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So in the morning it became as if harvested.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So by the morning, it became like As-Sarim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So it became as black, barren land.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and in the morning it was as if it were a garden plucked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And in the morning it was as if plucked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And by morning it lay as if it had already been harvested, a barren land.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then in the morning it became as though it had been reaped.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So, by dawn it was like a harvested field.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So the (garden) became black by the morning, like a pitch dark night (in complete ruins).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and in the morning it was if the garden had been reaped.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And in the morning it was as if picked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And it became as though reaped.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:20]   So by the morning it was like the darkness of night, in other words, black.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And in the morning it was as if plucked) it was like a dark night.
